column4: ok question. i want to edit the ip configuration file, but it says that the owner is "root" and wont let me edit. how do i fix this?
sudo vi /etc/network/interfaces
i've tried sudo, but i dont know how to save it once i've edited it.
:wq
uh,can you elaborate a bit?]
but if you have a gui, use the network manager applet
it worked! thanks a lot :D
thats a vi command to save
where do i enter that in though? inside the file?
in the command-mode of vi
ok
you can enter the command-mode in vi with ESC
oh cool. thanks.
on second though, not so much worked. it saved it apparently, but it didnt do what i wanted.
sudo /etc/init.d/networking restart
you're a lifesaver. thanks.
not me, vi(m) is the lifesaver .)
i'm trying to set up the static IP but the interfaces file doesnt seem to want to set what i put in as the stuff that auto eth0 uses.
paste your interfaces-file to pastebin
http://paste.ubuntu.com/492231/
when i put that in, it killed my auto-eth0 and now i have no internet period.
sudo won't let me type the letter "a" as the beginning of a line. whats goin on?
i could RAELLY use yur help here. sudo is messing up.
gnome-terminal? right click, properties and see the font-name
